description: From Ancient Greek ἀποτρόπαιος (apotrópaios), from ἀπό (apó, “away”) and τρόπος (trópos, “turn”); thus meaning “causing things to turn away”, as in “turns away evil”.

adjectives.description: apotropaic (comparative more apotropaic, superlative most apotropaic)

entries.meaning: (religion, mysticism) Intended to ward off evil. [from 1883]
An agent intended to ward off evil.
